node.title: GOP Rep. Upton Slams Subpoena Defiance, Leaves Open Possibility of Meadows Indictment
node.description: "If you refuse to participate in that, all of a sudden you don't really have an equal branch of government trying to get to the answers of this," he said Sunday.

node.title: Inquest into helicopter crash which killed seven set to begin
node.description: A coroner's inquest into one of the country's worst helicopter crashes in recent times begins in Christchurch today.

node.title: Health authorities warn rural Māori population is most at risk as Covid-19 spreads
node.description: As Covid-19 spreads to the Rotorua, Taupō and Tararua communities, authorites warn rural Māori are most at risk of the virus.

node.title: Petra Mayer, Books Editor for NPR and ‘Resident Nerd,’ Dies at 46
node.description: Ms. Mayer reported on Comic-Con and contributed to Book Concierge, NPR’s literary recommendation tool. She gravitated toward science fiction, romance and fantasy.

node.title: Adam Schiff Says Trump Officials 'Feel That They're Above the Law' When They Reject Subpoenas
node.description: The California Democratic congressman said that former Trump officials see that "there's something admirable about thumbing your nose at the institutions of our government."

node.title: Covid-19: A new case high, as 'clock ticking' for Christmas
node.description: With another record set for cases today, health experts say there are only a few days left for people to become fully vaccinated by the holidays.

node.title: Gottlieb: Booster messaging could be "one of the biggest missed opportunities" of pandemic
node.description: "We now see very clear evidence of declining vaccine effectiveness over time," Gottlieb said on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Taxi Explodes Outside Liverpool Hospital, Killing One
node.description: The cause of the explosion, which injured a second person, was not immediately clear. The investigation was being led by Counter Terrorism Policing North West with support from the local police.

node.title: GOP Rep. Gonzalez Says Trump Shouldn't Hold Office Again, Could Try to Steal 2024 Election
node.description: He also slammed the former president as a "political loser" who led the Republican Party "into a ditch."

node.title: Julie in France is getting $16,000 to switch to an EV. Spoiler: You're not
node.description: Governments around the world are offering juicy purchase incentives to speed car ownership to EVs. Here's what they're offering and how it compares with Australia.

node.title: Pfizer's pill is the latest COVID treatment to show promise. Here are some more
node.description: There is a growing portfolio of potential treatments to directly target SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, and to treat COVID symptoms.

node.title: NZ vaccine mandates kick in, but they're the 'trojan horse' of the far-right movement
node.description: From today, teachers and anyone else who works in a school in New Zealand needs to have at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine, but experts are warning with vaccination mandates and lingering lockdowns comes an increasing threat from far-right extremists.

node.title: How China's hard landing could expose Australia as a one-trick export pony
node.description: While jubilation flowed through Asian markets last week after China Evergrande narrowly stayed afloat, other Chinese developers are in major distress, spelling trouble for countries like Australia, writes Ian Verrender.

node.title: Police appeal for information on Tauranga boy's death
node.description: Tauranga Police are continuing their investigation into the death of five-year-old Malachi Subecz.

node.title: Fox News Host Confronts Ken Paxton Over Texas Stance on COVID Mandates: 'Not Consistent'
node.description: Chris Wallace pointed out that Texas has blocked businesses from implementing vaccine mandates but also argues that Biden's executive order goes against companies' rights to make their own decisions.

node.title: Mitch Marsh hits Australia to Twenty20 World Cup glory
node.description: Superb innings from Mitch Marsh and David Warner hand Australia their first Twenty20 World Cup title after New Zealand set them a mammoth target.

node.title: Qaddafi Son to Run for President in Libya
node.description: Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, the former heir apparent of the deposed Libyan dictator Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, filed his candidacy papers on Sunday for the election expected next month.

node.title: All Blacks fall to Ireland in Dublin
node.description: The All Blacks have been beaten 29-20 by Ireland in Dublin, their third defeat to the Irish in their last five tests.

node.title: GOP Senator Breaks With Trump on 'Hang Mike Pence' Chants Being 'Common Sense'
node.description: "There are issues of every election. I voted to certify the election. And what we have seen on this election, there are areas that needed to be looked into," said Wyoming Senator John Barrasso.

node.title: ‘Ghost Guns’: Firearm Kits Bought Online Fuel Epidemic of Violence
node.description: They are untraceable and can be ordered with a click by children, gang members and felons. The Biden administration is trying to crack down, but law enforcement officials believe the problem may be here to stay.

node.title: Afghan College Students Find a New Life, and Safety, in Iraq
node.description: Regarded as infidels by the Taliban, over 100 students from the American University in Kabul have found an unlikely refuge in the Iraqi Kurdish city of Sulaimaniya.

node.title: Williamson expects T20 World Cup final to be a contrast of cultures
node.description: Black Caps captain Kane Williamson believes the Twenty20 World Cup final against Australia will be a clash of styles.

node.title: Boat sinking in Gisborne harbour
node.description: A partially submerged boat in Gisborne's inner harbour is being monitored for any diesel leaks.

node.title: 'A lot of forgiveness' for driver who hit Taupō couple
node.description: The family of an elderly couple killed by a car in central Taupō hold no animosity against the driver.

node.title: Transcript: David Malpass on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with David Malpass, president of the World Bank Group, that aired Sunday, November 14, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Governor Jared Polis on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Governor Jared Polis of Colorado that aired Sunday, November 14, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Neel Kashkari on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Neel Kashkari, president and CEO of the Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank, that aired Sunday, November 14, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: El elusivo Sr. Col Rizada
node.description: Él era todo lo que esperaba y deseaba. ¿Por qué no ha vuelto a Whole Foods?

node.title: How My Faith Shapes My View of Racism and History
node.description: White Christians should not shy away from the truth about our past

node.title: Do Religion and Science Clash or Coexist?
node.description: Faith and science; a cheer for New Yorkers; the culture factor in politics; exploiting the cosmos; religious exemptions for vaccines.

node.title: At Least 1 Dead After Quakes Strike Southern Iran
node.description: Two moderate temblors hit Hormozgan Province on Sunday afternoon, state TV reported.

node.title: Trump Rails Against 1/6 Investigation as Subpoenas Gain Force, Rioters Sentenced
node.description: The former president lambasted the probe for using "prosecutors, local, state, and federal, to torment and destroy innocent people."

node.title: Mike Pence Will 'Put Up a Formidable Fight' Against Trump in 2024, Former Adviser Predicts
node.description: "The coronation of Donald Trump would be the worst thing," Alyssa Farah, who previously served as the former vice president's press secretary, warned.

node.title: Bernie Sanders Cruelly Mocked by Elon Musk Saying He Forgets He's Still Alive
node.description: The billionaire was replying to a tweet from the senator which said: "We must demand that the extremely wealthy pay their fair share. Period."

node.title: Southwest Employee Hospitalized After Being Punched by Passenger
node.description: An airline spokesperson told Newsweek that the female passenger "verbally and physically" assaulted an operations agent shortly after boarding a flight from Dallas to New York City.

node.title: Transcript: Dr. Scott Gottlieb on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Dr. Scott Gottlieb that aired Sunday, November 14, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: What to Cook This Week
node.description: Do some pre-Thanksgiving housework. It will pay dividends.

node.title: Why Music Drives Us to Mayhem
node.description: Generation after generation of young people are drawn to places where they’re pushed, jostled, pummeled or worse. Why do we run into a seething crowd?

node.title: Denmark’s Hard Lessons About Trust and the Pandemic
node.description: Social and institutional trust are critical when the future is uncertain.

node.title: Without Parental Leave I Might Be Dead
node.description: Family leave should be a right, not a privilege.

node.title: Donald Trump Trolls 'Lyin' Brian Williams' Over MSNBC Departure: 'Won't be Missed'
node.description: The former president made reference to the Iraq helicopter scandal which nearly ended the veteran anchor's career in 2015.

node.title: Austria will confine the unvaccinated to their homes in a targeted lockdown.
node.description: The country, facing the biggest surge in virus cases since the pandemic started, is putting strict curbs on the movement of those without shots.

node.title: Luke Burbank's tips for enjoying Thanksgiving
node.description: A year after COVID cancelled many family gatherings, the holiday is back, and the "Sunday Morning" commentator has some do's and don'ts about getting the most from your family's feast.

node.title: Stray Cat Badly Burned By Volcano Named Magma By Rescuers
node.description: Severely singed cat is recovering after being scorched by ash from the Cumbre Vieja volcano.

node.title: Ted Lieu Slams GOP for Failing to Punish Gosar Over 'Despicable Video' as Censure Calls Grow
node.description: The Arizona Republican congressman has come under fire for sharing an anime video on social media that depicted him killing New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and attacking President Biden.

node.title: Ex-Trump Official Praises Republicans Facing Former President's Criticism: 'Badge of Honor'
node.description: Chris Krebs said other Republicans are "ashamed" they aren't facing Donald Trump's backlash because they "didn't step up."

node.title: Halle Berry on the fighter she's become
node.description: The Academy Award-winning actress has always found inspiration and motivation via the spirit of boxing. That passion inspired her first film as a director, "Bruised," about a mixed martial arts fighter.

node.title: Portugal, the little country that could … get vaccinated
node.description: One of the most vaccinated countries on Earth is now welcoming visitors after having achieved a 98% vaccination rate for its eligible population, a success it achieved by approaching the virus as if going to war.

node.title: Donors Withhold Gifts to Protest Changes at Hamptons Sculpture Garden
node.description: Some patrons of the LongHouse Reserve are upset that its veteran director was let go, but the board says it needed new leadership to expand the garden into a museum with a broader mission.

node.title: Another Gaddafi in Libya? Muammar's son pitches for power as presidential election draws near
node.description: Saif al-Islam al-Gaddafi has registered himself as a presidential candidate for the December elections. He hasn't appeared publicly in almost a decade.
